reference.title: Log Events

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Descriptions and meanings for log events captured by UPS systems; guidance on interpreting event codes and actions.

section.p: The following table lists events that can appear on the display log and some assigned to LEDs on the user interface:

row.entry: Message number
Log
Description
Corrective action
The system is in standby.
The system is in battery operation.
The system is in normal operation.
The system is in requested static bypass operation due to a user request.
The system is in temporary static bypass operation due to a problem in the system.
Check the event log to find out why the system has switched to static bypass operation.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The battery charger has been set to OFF state. The batteries are not charged in this state.
The battery charger has been set to Float charge state. The batteries are charged with the configured float charge voltage.
The battery charger has been set to Boost charge mode. The batteries are charged with the configured boost charge voltage.
The battery charger has been set to Initial charge mode. The batteries are charged with the configured initial charge voltage.
The battery charger has been set to Cyclic charge mode. The batteries are charged with the configured cyclic charge voltage.
The digital input to block boost/initial charge is activated.
The rectifier part of the power module is not working.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The charger part of the power module is not working.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The inverter part of the power module is not working.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The UPS is unable to synchronize to the bypass source.
Check that the inverter is on.
Check the bypass source quality (voltage, frequency).
Contact Schneider Electric.
The system is in static bypass operation. The bypass supplies the load (temporary or requested static bypass operation).

The static bypass switch is not energized, the communication wiring from the UPS controller to the static bypass switch controller is disconnected or the static bypass switch controller is inoperable.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The static bypass switch is no longer controlled by the UPS controller and is locked in the on state.
Contact Schneider Electric.
DC content detected in requested static bypass operation.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The maintenance bypass breaker MBB is closed.
The power module temperature is above 90 °C.
Check the air inlet of the UPS.
Check the ambient temperature.
Reduce the load.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The power module temperature is above 100 °C (delay 60 seconds). The inverter is shut down immediately.
Check the air inlet of the UPS.
Check the ambient temperature.
Reduce the load.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The battery temperature is above the configured warning level.
Check the air inlet.
Check the ambient temperature.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The battery temperature is above the configured shutdown level. The battery charger switches off.
Check the air inlet.
Check the ambient temperature.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The sensor, connected to the external connection board, measures a temperature above the configured warning level.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The sensor, connected to the external connection board, measures a temperature above the configured warning level.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The sensor, connected to the external connection board, measures a temperature above the configured warning level.
Contact Schneider Electric.
One of the power module fans is inoperable.
Contact Schneider Electric.
One of the static bypass switch fans is inoperable.
Contact Schneider Electric.
One of the transformer fans is inoperable (input transformer, output transformer or bypass transformer).
Contact Schneider Electric.
The input transformer temperature is above the configured threshold level. After 10 minutes, the rectifier is shut down and the system changes to battery operation.
Check the air inlet of the UPS.
Check the ambient temperature.
Reduce the battery charging current.
Reduce the load.
Contact Schneider Electric.

The output transformer temperature is above the configured threshold level. After 10 minutes, the system tries to change to static bypass operation within the next 2 minutes. If the change to static bypass operation is not possible due to bad bypass quality the inverter is shut down after these 2 minutes.
Check the air inlet of the UPS.
Check the ambient temperature.
Reduce the load.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The bypass transformer temperature is above the threshold level.
Check the air inlet of the UPS.
Check the ambient temperature.
Reduce the load.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The mains input transformer temperature sensor is not connected or shorted.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The output transformer temperature sensor is not connected or shorted.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The bypass transformer temperature sensor is not connected or shorted.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The input voltage is out of the configured tolerance.
Check the quality of the input (voltage and frequency).
The input voltage on primary side of the input transformer is out of the configured tolerance.
Check the quality of the input (voltage and frequency).
The input voltage is out of tolerance.
Check the quality of the input (voltage and frequency).
The input frequency is out of the configured tolerance.
Check the quality of the input (voltage and frequency).
A input input phase is missing.
Contact Schneider Electric.
One phase of the input voltage on the primary side of the input transformer is missing.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The mains PFC rectifier is unable to synchronize to the input input.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The input neutral is missing.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The bypass voltage is out of the configured tolerance. The UPS is not able to transfer to static bypass operation.
Check the quality of the bypass (voltage and frequency).
The bypass mains voltage on the primary side of the bypass transformer is out of the configured tolerance.
Check the quality of the bypass (voltage and frequency).
The bypass voltage is out of the configured tolerance. The UPS is unable to transfer to static bypass operation.
Check the quality of the bypass (voltage and frequency).
The bypass frequency is out of the configured tolerance. The UPS is unable to transfer to static bypass operation.
Check the quality of the bypass (voltage and frequency).
One phase of the bypass mains is missing.
Contact Schneider Electric.
One phase of the bypass voltage on the primary side of the transformer is missing.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The UPS output voltage is out of the configured tolerance.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The output voltage on the secondary side of the output transformer is out of the configured tolerance.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The UPS output voltage is out of the configured tolerance.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The UPS output frequency is out of the configured tolerance.
Contact Schneider Electric.
One phase of the output voltage on the secondary side of the transformer is missing.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The load is above the configured load alarm level.
Reduce the load.
The inverter current limiter is active.
Reduce the load.
The UPS output is overloaded (>105%).
Reduce the load.
The battery voltage is above the configured high battery voltage shutdown level. The charger is shut down.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The battery voltage is above the configured high battery voltage warning level. This warning is suppressed in battery operation.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The battery voltage is below the configured low battery voltage warning level.
Charge the battery. If the battery does not charge, contact Schneider Electric.
The battery voltage is below the configured low battery voltage shutdown level.
Charge the battery.
The UPS measures a positive battery earth fault.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The UPS measures a negative battery earth fault.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The advanced battery monitoring test has been started.
The advanced battery monitoring test has been completed.
The advanced battery monitoring test has been aborted.
The advanced battery monitoring test has detected a weak battery.
Charge the battery. If the battery does not charge, contact Schneider Electric.
The advanced battery monitoring test has detected an inoperable battery.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The battery runtime is less than 2 minutes above the configured warning level.
The battery runtime is below the configured battery runtime level.
The battery discharge test has been started.
The battery discharge test has been completed.
The battery discharge test has been aborted.
The unit input breaker UIB is open.
The battery breaker BB is open.
The static switch input breaker SSIB is open.
The unit output breaker UOB is open.
The bypass backfeed contactor K401 is open.
The ABUS wiring is disconnected or the ABUS termination is incorrect.
Contact Schneider Electric.
No master is present in the redundant system.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The actual load is too high for redundant operation. If one UPS switches OFF, the remaining systems would be overloaded.
Reduce the load. Check that all the UPSs are ON.
At least one UPS is isolated or turned off. In this case the redundancy operation is not available.
Reduce the load. Check that all the UPSs are ON.
The internal or external PBUS1 wiring (parallel bus) is disconnected or the PBUS1 termination is incorrect.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The internal or external PBUS2 wiring (parallel bus) is disconnected or the PBUS2 termination is incorrect.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The internal or external PBUS1 wiring (parallel bus) is disconnected or the PBUS1 termination is incorrect.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The internal or external PBUS2 wiring (parallel bus) is disconnected or the PBUS2 termination is incorrect.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The digital input "emergency power off (EPO)" is activated (contact open) or the EPO wiring is disconnected.
Check the EPO switch. If the EPO is off, contact Schneider Electric.
An internal inoperable state was detected.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The system has been locked in static bypass operation after eight unsuccessful tries to switch back to normal or battery operation.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The life cycle monitoring recommends to replace the fan modules.
The life cycle monitoring recommends to replace the battery.
The life cycle monitoring recommends to replace the power modules.
The life cycle monitoring recommends to replace the air filters.
The warranty on the product has expired.
External connection board input 1 open / close
External connection board input 2 open / close
There is at least one pending alert in the system.
Check alarm.
The communication to the static bypass switch is not working or DC is detected during requested static bypass operation.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The bypass voltage is out of the configured tolerance, a phase is missing, there is an invalid phase rotation or the frequency is out of the configured tolerance.
The output voltage or the frequency is out of configured tolerance.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The mains input voltage is out of the configured tolerance, a phase is missing, there is an invalid phase rotation or the frequency is out of the configured tolerance.
The UPS measures a temperature above the threshold level in one of the power modules or in one of the transformers.
Check the air inlet and the air filters.
Check the ambient temperature.
Check the output load.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The battery voltage is out of the configured tolerance or the battery runtime is too short.
Check if the UPS is in battery operation. If the UPS is not in battery operation, contact Schneider Electric.
One of the transformer-, static bypass switch- or power module fans is inoperable.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The UPS measures a battery earth fault.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The PFC rectifier or the charger is inoperable.
Contact Schneider Electric.
The inverter is inoperable.
Contact Schneider Electric.
